intro: Osmitopsis pinnatifida subsp. serrata, commonly known as the serrated osmitopsis, is a flowering plant native to the southern regions of South America. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant features narrow, pinnately compound leaves with serrated edges, giving it its subspecies name. It produces small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters, typical of the daisy family. Osmitopsis pinnatifida subsp. serrata is often found in dry, open habitats such as grasslands and rocky slopes.
